docs.lead_paragraph: Between sobs and prayers, family members struggled yesterday to understand why 13-year-old Randy Carlote died while doing what he loved best -- playing baseball. Randy had shown up at Ditmas Junior High School in Kensington, Brooklyn, on Saturday two hours early for tryouts for a baseball team run by the Youth Service League, a community group, his family said. He and other boys had been running inside the gym for less than two minutes when Randy grabbed his chest and fell to the floor, said his mother, Blasina Jimenez, 41, who was watching from the bleachers.

headline.main: Tears and Questions After Boy's Fatal Collapse at School

docs.abstract: Randy Carlote dies while warming up for baseball game at Ditmas Junior High School in Kensington, Brooklyn; family awaits autopsy results to determine what killed him; profile; photo (M)
